subtitle: Get ready to be a mother!
description: Get ready to be a mother!
title: Month 9
content:
Created by BabyCenter

Your baby may arrive any day now! Inside you he is shedding the fine hair he grew in the middle of pregnancy. He is also losing the waxy, white substance on his skin which protected him while he was floating in the liquid.

Your baby is developing layers of fat under his skin, which will help keep him warm when he is born. Newborn babies need to be kept warm. The best way to do this is to hold him close to your chest inside your clothes.

You may wonder how you will know when the baby is coming. Here is how you can tell: 

1. You may notice little spots of blood on your underclothes. This is a sign that things may begin in the next day or two. 
2.  You may have pains low down on your body. They get stronger, regular and more painful as you get nearer to the birth of your baby.  
3. You may have a gush or trickle of water. If this happens you should go straight to the health facility.

Make sure you know how to get to the health facility. You need a midwife, nurse or doctor to care for you. Check that you have credit on your phone and money for your transportation to get there if your husband, trusted friend or family member is not available to accompany you.  

Reviewed by Friends of the White Ribbon Alliance
